Authors:
Jorge Portella Bezerra, Paulo Vanderlei Ferreira, Danilo
Batista Pinho, Ailton Reis, Leonardo da Fonseca Barbosa, Roberto Ramos
Sobrinho, Iraildes Pereira Assunção, Gaus Silvestre Andrade Lima
Title:
First Report of Anthracnose on Chayote Fruits (Sechium edule)
Caused by Colletotrichum brevisporum
Abstract:
Colletotrichum orbiculare is traditionally considered the
etiological agent of anthracnose on Cucurbitaceae as chayote, cucumber,
melons, pumpkin, squash and watermelon. In the present study, an isolate
of Colletotrichum with distinct morphological characteristics of C.
orbiculare was collected in chayote fruits in Antonio Carlos, Santa
Catarina state, Brazil. Based on morphological and molecular data
[partial sequences of the regions actin (ACT), calmodulin (CAL), chitin
synthase (CHS), glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAPDH),
internal transcribed spacer (ITS) and beta-tubulin 2 (beta-TUB)], the
isolate reported here (code COUFAL7300) was identified as C.
brevisporum. This isolated was pathogenic on chayote and commercial
(Acclaim, Syngenta) and non-commercial fruits of Cucumis melo from a
Melon Breeding Program in Brazil. To our knowledge, this is the first
report of C. brevisporum causing anthracnose on chayote fruits
worldwide.
